qas.question: The earliest Mahayana sutra include the very first version of what genre?
Texts concerning Aksobhya Buddha were written down in what century?
Author Warder believes that the Mahayana originated in the south of India in what area?

context: The earliest Mahāyāna sūtras to include the very first versions of the <a0_0>Prajñāpāramitā<a0_0/> genre, along with texts concerning Akṣobhya Buddha, which were probably written down in the <a1_0>1st century BCE<a1_0/> in the south of India. Guang Xing states, "Several scholars have suggested that the Prajñāpāramitā probably developed among the Mahāsāṃghikas in southern India, in the <a2_0>Āndhra<a2_0/> country, on the Kṛṣṇa River." A.K. Warder believes that "the Mahāyāna originated in the south of India and almost certainly in the Āndhra country."
